channel.title: 1.0.11 Patch Notes
channel.description:
## General: * Trials have been limited to two a day, even if the accused is pardoned. (Was upped from 1 a day in 11a)
## Quality of Life: * The number of players needed to start a trial now appears above the voting panel. * Chat is now saved if you disconnect and reconnect while still in-game. If you reconnect from the lobby, the chat won't be saved.
## Prince: * Jailing a player now prevents all visits.
## Sorcerer: * Magic Dust now makes all players appear as magic users until the next day.
## Bug Fix: * Fixed a bug where special unicode characters would freeze the game. Was found by Marshal Webb.

item.title: 1.0.11 Patch Notes
item.dc:creator: EvadableMoxie
item.description:
I never felt that VFL was a problem that needed solving, and instead it would be better if evil roles actually learned to lie, but I’m not strongly against this, either. I feel like 3 trials per day would be better, but I guess we’ll see how 2 goes.

The main issue I have with Sorc/Inquis is that it feels like Sorc generally just dies to BD rather than the Inquis. The Inquis feels more like a wildcad than a hunter because just like any other NK odds are they’re going to get caught and killed eventually anyway. And, once the Sorc is dead, the inquis isn’t obligated to use his powers to help BD. He’s a neutral, he can do whatever he wants, or just do nothing.

By making magic dust stronger and therefore the Inquis’s investigative powers weaker, this is only going to make the issue worse. They’ll be even more games where the Inquis dicks around for 5 days before BD kills the Sorc and they ‘win’ while having done nothing.

item.dc:creator: bbiaglla
item.description:
I think the length of day is perfect. You feel like the days are short because we trial for logs or we execute and the day ends. If we exec first thing in the day then it was effectively 30 seconds long. I feel your perception is skewed. Those days, d2 specifically, where is nothing going on seem like forever. Just people bullshitting in chat and not even trying to get info. Mostly because whispers mean evil. If everyone whispered all the time we could get off the whispers are evil meta and actually get and pass information. Right now it’s a death sentence because no-one does it so the few that do stand out.

I know on days where it is throne of whispers, whether I’m evil or good, I don’t feel like weeding through who whispered who. Too much to keep up tbh. But on days where one person does it stands out and I kill that person.
